args:
My former husband and I were lured into the
Syndicate by a man known only as the Doctor.
Once there, we began researching whether fusion
magic could be used for legitimate and beneficial
medical purposes.

Sadly, our research became the foundation upon
which the Syndicate's foul experiments would be
conducted. So in an attempt to atone for our sins,
we conducted other work in secret—work we
hoped might save victims of those experiments

So it's finally finished... This device
will allow us to control the effects of
wyrmbinding. But why are we building
it into a sword?
You know as well as any what happens to\nthe poor test subjects of wyrmbinding\nwhen it spins out of control.
The heat of the uncontrolled mana melts\nthe body from the inside out. It is the most\nhorrible sight imaginable.

There is no guarantee that this device
will succeed in controlling the effects of
wyrmbinding. But if it fails, we can at least
grant the victim a quick and painless end.
Hence the sword. Yes, I see it now.
Perhaps I am getting ahead of myself by\ncalling this the savior of those subjects.
I know, I know! I'm late.
I should not be surprised; you haven't\narrived on time since we first teamed\nup to eliminate the Syndicate.
I won't let nothing tie me down, baby.\nNot even time.
So then, what did you learn from your\ninvestigation?
You were right on the money about what's\ncausing the disappearances around here.

They're using a cave on the lakeshore to
the south as their base and taking all their
kidnapping victims there—and I'm sure we
both know what happens to 'em after that.
Human experimentation, undoubtedly.\nWe must help these people.
Great! Then I'll bust into the base and\nstart crackin' skulls.
You will do no such thing. That kind of\nunfettered bravado will accomplish\nnothing save getting the captives killed.
But Aldred raids bases all the time!

Yes, but this base is in a cave that could
collapse in a pitched battle—especially if
one uses high-powered attacks such as
those from your Renegade Queen.
Yeah, I suppose you're right. Boo!\nSo what's the plan, then?
By the looks of things, the Syndicate still\nhasn't caught on to the fact that I am\nwarring against them.
The former colleague who did your hubby\ndirty hid that bit of information, yeah?
Yes. He said it was so I could return to the \nSyndicate to be with him.
I agree. Ironically, it now works\nin MY favor.
Unlike you, I've been working behind the\nscenes as opposed to on the front lines.
And because of that, I can easily pretend\nto be one of them once more.
So you're the same Researcher 90 who\nlaid the foundation for the Synthetic\nShapeshifting Project, eh?

I'd heard you were an exceptionally
talented mind who was permitted to go
without a mask, but I never expected you
to be a woman of such remarkable beauty.
No, not at all. I was merely surprised.\nNow then, what brings you to this facility?
I have come to observe your experiments\nso I might use them to further my own\nresearch.
Your dedication to science is admirable.\nYou'll be recruited to the upper echelons\nin no time with that attitude.
For my part, I'm hoping to push past the\ntop brass and stand at the Master's right\nhand. And if you were to be promoted...
Naturally, I will repay you for allowing me\nto observe and learn from your work.
We are happy to have you for as long as\nyou like. But if I may ask, what is that\nsword you carry?
I've heard tell of raids on Syndicate bases\nof late, so my husband gave it to me for\nself-defense.
Oh, I see. Of course she's married.\nJust my luck!
Repeat after me, you dogs!\n＂For the glory of the Syndicate!＂
For the glory of the Syndicate!\nFor the glory of the Syndicate!
It sounds like someone needs to be\nreeducated. Return him to the classroom.
No! Don't take me back there again!\nAAAAAAAH!
I see you're brainwashing the test subjects.

We also cast a simple spell on them
to enhance their physical capabilities,
and train them in both the combat and
espionage arts.
This base is being used to mass-produce\nsoldiers, and any who meet our standards\nwill be granted a Syndicate mask.

They are disposed of, which is something I
would prefer to avoid. Not because I care
for their lives, mind you, but because a
high disposal rate impacts my bottom line.

This is why improving the success rate is
one of our top priorities—and I have put
our efforts into the hands of this man here,
Researcher 241.
This is Researcher Number 241,\na man of most exceptional talent.
I see you are also not required to wear a\nmask. Researcher 90 then, I take it?
She has come to observe our work here.\nPlease guide her and see that she is\nprovided with anything she needs.
It would be my honor to escort a\nresearcher of such fabled genius!
Is something the matter? You look pale.
(He looks just like my late husband...)
